name: Ant War: Domination
description: Emerge from the ant hill with a handful of ants and a dream... to conquer the world. Train your ants with new skills, manage their daily work load, and travel across the town in search of new land. Sharpen your pincers and be ready for a fight because everyone from beetles and slugs, to the town police and the army will try to stop your...

So I'll get this out of the way, I myself love this game, but that is STRICTLY because I played it when I was like 7 years old. I would never recommend this game to anyone though. It's fraught with flaws.  First of all, the UI is extremely odd, and can be very confusing to navigate. The whole game is a clicking simulator, which isn't bad for some, as games of the like are usually great ways to pass the time, which is one redeeming factor the game has. The art. HOOOOOLY CRAP the art. The whole game is literally clip art images that you can easily find on google, some of which have been animated very simply (we're talking a few pivot points on some images in like, Adobe AfterEffects). The music and sound effects are maddingly repetitive, as well as the 'battle' sequences which are just some more clicking (if you win you get some stuff if not oh well).  Essentially, this game is horrendous, if you buy it, use it to waste time and only to do so. If you have some nostalgia to deal with like I did, go right ahead, I love this game sure, but that doesn't make it good. Sort of like loving a terrible, terrible, movie.  TL;DR: I played this game as a kid and loved it, still love it, but it's still terrible.

Terrible lazy developement that even a sub $2 price tag isn't appolagetic enough for. No strategy, no choices that matter, simply set percentages and endlessly click the same buttons. This game would bore a 6 year old.

'Ant War: Donimation' is an action-packed strategic game with intense gameplay, incredible graphics, comfortable and fitting controls, and overall a lot of fun to play. It has an exciting, well-paced story mode campeign, followed with a mutliplayer that I enjoyed playing. It has so many matches going on that there's literally an endless amount of gameplay. Also, the potential content and the price ratio is absolutely unbelievable. Definitely worth buying. I know I'm usually really critical, with no game reaching more than 7/10, but this game is so perfect that it's a definite...    10/10.
